newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL - Microsoft off, Micron up.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL - Microsoft off, Micron up.

text.p: Shares in Microsoft Corp traded lower preceding Friday's market open as investors became uneasy on news of a U.S. Department of Justice probe into the company's Internet software business, traders said.
Ahead of the opening bell, Microsoft shed 1-1/4 to 136-1/2, according to Instinet.

Also, Micron Technology Inc stock gained 1-1/4 to 28-5/8 after the company reported fiscal fourth quarter income of $0.09 per share, $0.12 above the consesus per share loss expected by analysts, but sharply below the $1.30 per share earned in the year ago period.
Traders also said Texas Instruments rose one to 53-1/4 in buying related to Micron's above-expectations earnings report.

Ventritex Inc stock soared before the regular-session open, reaching 20 from 15-5/8 on buying related to last night's news that the U.S. Food and Drug Administration granted Ventritex premarket approval for commercial distribution of its Contour implantable cardioverter defibrillators, the V-145D and the LT V-135D, to treat abnormally rapid heart beats.
PanAmSat Corp shares gained 3/4 to 28-1/8 after it announced with Hughes Electronics Corp an agreement to merge the companies' satellite services operations to create a new public corporation.
PanAmSat shareholders will get $1.5 billion in cash and 28.5 percent of the new company. Hughes, which made no stock moves ahead of the open, will own 71.5 percent of the company.
